thread.title: Girls Soccer Roundup for Saturday, Oct. 17
thread.title_full: Girls Soccer Roundup for Saturday, Oct. 17

title: Girls Soccer Roundup for Saturday, Oct. 17
text:
Girls Soccer Roundup for Saturday, Oct. 17 Click here for Saturday’s girls soccer roundup Post to Facebook Girls Soccer Roundup for Saturday, Oct. 17 Click here for Saturday’s girls soccer roundup Check out this story on mycentraljersey.com: http://mycj.co/1LAoqcd Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Simeon Pincus, @SimeonPincus 2:39 p.m. EDT October 17, 2015 Girls soccer 2 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Somerset County Tournament quarterfinals 
Somerville 5, Watchung Hills 1: Marisa Adelman netted a hat trick and Christina Cernuto finished with two goals and two assists as the sixth-seeded Somerville High School girls soccer team notched the upset in dominating fashion Saturday, toppling third-seeded Watchung Hills 5-1 in the quarterfinals of the Somerset County Tournament. The Pioneers, who needed three rounds of a shootout to avoid being upset themselves by 11 th -seeded North Plainfield in last weekend’s second round, will travel to second-seeded Bridgewater-Raritan for next Saturday’s semifinals. Ally Grunstein scored for the Warriors, hitting a 45-yard free kick in the first half. 
Bridgewater-Raritan 2, Mount St. Mary 1: Delaney Reilly and Hayley Soriano scored goals and Alexa Barbagallo made two saves as second-seeded Bridgewater-Raritan held off the upset-minded No. 10 seed. The Panthers will play host to sixth-seeded Somerville in next Saturday’s semifinals. Alaina Parisella scored for the Mount Lions. 
Ridge 5, Bernards 0: Chrissy Weyrauch netted two goals and the Ridge defense held Bernards without a shot on goal, as the top-seeded Red Devils rolled. Julia Lindsey, Brielle Farrell and Erin Convery all added goals for Ridge, which will play host to fourth-seeded Hillsborough in next Saturday’s semifinals. Nicole Sullivan made 12 saves for eighth-seeded Bernards. 
Hunterdon/Warren/Sussex Tournament quarterfinals 
North Hunterdon 1, Belvidere 0 (OT): Heather Tostevin hit for an overtime goal and sixth-seeded North Hunterdon toppled third-seeded Belvidere in the quarterfinals of the Hunterdon/Warren/Sussex Tournament. Olivia Ripnyak made seven saves for the Lions, who will visit second-seeded Sparta in next Saturday’s semifinals. 
Hunterdon Central 5, High Point 0: Two goals from Brianna Floyd, and a goal and assist apiece from Mackenzie Mullins, Brie Pavol and Luciana Zullo powered top-seeded and three-time defending champion Hunterdon Central into the semifinals. Sarah Kolody (three saves) and Bristol Pizzuto (two saves) split the shutout for the Red Devils, who welcome in fifth-seeded Warren Hills for Saturday’s semifinals. 
Union County Tournament quarterfinals 
Westfield 1, Governor Livingston 0: Julia Frontero scored off a Hannah Liddy assist in the first half and the Westfield defense did the rest as the third-seeded Blue Devils advanced. Lizzie Brucia (four saves) and Hailey Reilly (two saves) split the shutout for Westfield, which will visit second-seeded Cranford in next Saturday’s semifinals. Olivia Emmanuel made seven saves for the sixth-seeded Highlanders. 
Scotch Plains-Fanwood 5, A.L. Johnson 0: Kerri McNeely scored two goals and Erika Muskus chipped in a goal and an assist to send top-seeded Scotch Plains-Fanwood into the semifinals. Sophie Brause chipped in two assists for the Raiders, who will play host to fourth-seeded Oak Knoll the semifinals next Saturday. 
Regular season 
Metuchen 3, Spotswood 1: Katharine Chura scored two goals and Alexa Craft-Zaletel added another to pace Metuchen. The Bulldogs (13-2) also got three assists from Rory Josell, while Spotswood (12-2-1) got a goal from Danielle Wittig. 
Piscataway 2, Sayreville 1: Lela Allen scored twice and Jackie McEvoy finished with 11 saves as Piscataway improved to 6-7. Khadija Barrie hit for Sayreville (8-7). 
East Brunswick 2, Hightstown 0: Senior Stacie Golin scored her first varsity goal on Senior Day to lead East Brunswick. Golin took a pass from Katrina Nguyen-DeMary and lofted a perfect shot over the goalkeeper’s hands and just under the crossbar to give the Bears the early lead in the sixth minute. Sabria Glasgow collected another feed from Nguyen-DeMary 30 minutes later and beat the keeper on a well-placed shot from just outside the penalty area. Dominique Brancato (two saves) and Lauren Krinsky (one save) combined to earn the shutout. 2 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://mycj.co/1LAoqcd TOP VIDEOS
